author: MicDobbe
title: Good Key Chain
review:
Glad I bought this Key Chain

There is obviously no building this key chain, it comes whole in the package

Be  warned that no parts are removable, you can not take this apart as you could a regular minifigure.
The bottom part however can be connected to other lego if you wanted so and the legs are separately movable.


I feel this is a pretty accurate version of Boba Fett and a cool little piece to add to my keys.

author: ChrisBricks81
title: Great but fragile keychain
review:
This is a very nice keychain. As a big Boba Fett fan it was the obvious choice when I needed a new one.

It just looks great although it doesn't have a range finder. It just wouldn't stick to the head ofcourse when it's in your pocket.

One big big downside about this awesome keychain... The paint doesn't stay on. Within a week the paint started to come off as my keys scratched the minifig.

would have been nice if it had some extra tough coating or something.

author: alfred_the_buttler
title: Got it for the minifigure
review:
So I’m not too interested in a keychain, however, I wanted a Boba Fett minifigure and the ones available on Bricklink are almost as expensive as the sets that include them. So I saw this as a cheap way to obtain a minifigure, even if it isn’t perfect. 

On YouTube I saw videos showing how to remove the keychain by heating it with a candle until you can just pull it out, so I figured it was worth a try. Turns out that it is just as easy as they make it look in the videos. 

Yes, there is a hole in the top of his helmet, but I can deal with that. It does sit a little loose on the head so you may need to be a bit careful while playing. You can attach a rage finder to the helmet as well, but it doesn’t come with one. The head is blank, so you may want to swap it out with a storm trooper head. The jet pack and cape are normal. But it’s the body and legs that are interesting. The body is missing the peg that the head attaches to. Instead, there is a hole where that peg should be. The legs, likewise are missing their two pegs and they have been replaced with a single long peg that protrudes thru the hole where the neck should be. This is sufficient for holding the minifigure together, and while it is assembled it looks perfectly normal. 

So may son won’t be able to completely swap out body parts on this minifigure, but he can swap out many of them, and it’s kind of cool to have this unique construction. I’m happy to have this and am glad I didn’t have to pay a fortune for a legit Boba Fett!
